testcase.name: rearVideoRec
testcase.system-out: Test:Start  Test10F Scenario is as follows 1.Launch Camera application and start front camera video recording for all host applicable resolutions in uSD Card 2.Playback front Highest recorded video from uSD card for 30 seconds, pause video playback, lock mobile and wait 30 seconds, unlock mobile and playback video from pause video duration 3.Move front camera recorded videos from Camera folder to Test10F folder Setting up the appium desired capabilities  Launch Home screen and clear recent AppsLaunch Camera Application for rear camera video recording Test10F_Fcam_res: 3 resolutions supported If change to uSD card pop-up exists select Cancel change to SD card element not found : org.openqa.selenium.NoSuchElementException: An element could not be located on the page using the given search parameters. For documentation on this error, please visit: https://www.seleniumhq.org/exceptions/no_such_element.html Build info: version: '3.141.59', revision: 'e82be7d358', time: '2018-11-14T08:17:03' System info: host: 'BNPLYY2', ip: '192.168.192.26', os.name: 'Windows 10', os.arch: 'amd64', os.version: '10.0', java.version: '1.8.0_202' Driver info: io.appium.java_client.android.AndroidDriver Capabilities {automationName: UiAutomator2, databaseEnabled: false, desired: {automationName: UiAutomator2, deviceName: Galaxy A22 5G, newCommandTimeout: 1200, platformName: android, platformVersion: 11, udid: R9ZR704W3DM}, deviceApiLevel: 30, deviceManufacturer: samsung, deviceModel: SM-A226B, deviceName: R9ZR704W3DM, deviceScreenDensity: 450, deviceScreenSize: 1080x2408, deviceUDID: R9ZR704W3DM, javascriptEnabled: true, locationContextEnabled: false, networkConnectionEnabled: true, newCommandTimeout: 1200, pixelRatio: 2.8125, platform: LINUX, platformName: Android, platformVersion: 11, statBarHeight: 65, takesScreenshot: true, udid: R9ZR704W3DM, viewportRect: {height: 2143, left: 0, top: 65, width: 1080}, warnings: {}, webStorageEnabled: false} Session ID: a5a767f7-1220-4e91-ab13-f010ed198123 *** Element info: {Using=id, value=android:id/button2} If Location access Permission Request Pop Exists Click on Cancel. Switch To front Camera mode if current Exiting camera is rear camera mode Switch to video mode Select settings option Swipe up and Select Storage location Select uSD card as Storage option Click on front video size and select resolution Select 1st Front Video Resolution:FRONT_CAMCORDER_RESOLUTION_UHD_60 recordingDurationfront = 180 Start front video recodring Click front video size and select second resolution Select second Back Video Resolution:BACK_CAMCORDER_RESOLUTION_FHD_60 recordingDurationfront1 = 180 Start front video recodring Switch To Rear Camera mode if current Exiting camera is Front camera mode Pass: Test10F pass for front camera video recording  Launch file manager application and verify recorded video capture uSD Card Swipe up to select uSD card Select SD card switch to grid view mode to select DCIM folder Select DCIM Folder Select camera folder switch to list view mode Click More options Click select all Test10F_Fcam_video: 2 videos captured successfully Pass: Test10F pass for front camera video recording  Calling VideoPlayBackForSleepWake() Launch File Manager application and playback front recorded video from USD for 30 seconds, pause video playback, locking phone and unlock after 30 seconds delay and playback video from pause duration. Launching file manager application Swipe up to select uSD card Select SD card switch to grid view mode to select DCIM folder Select DCIM Folder Select Camera folder switch to list view mode Select more options Select Sort by Newest date first Click on first file to play highest recorded resolution video file Tap Somewhere on Screen for contents to visible on Screen Click pause video button Lock Mobile with 30 seconds delay Unlock Mobile PlayBack Video from Pause duartion Tap Somewhere on Screen for contents to visible on Screen Fast forward video play back for 10 seconds Pause video play back Pass: Pass Test10F Pass for Pause Video Playback scenario   calling DatamoveOperation() to move front camera recorded videos files to Test10F folder Re-launch file manager application and select external storage for data move operation, select all rear camera videos present in camera folder and move to Test10 folder Select external storage switch to grid view mode and select DCIM folder Select DCIM folder Select camera folder switch to list view mode Click More options Click select all Click More options select move to option select uSD Card Select ADD NEW Folder option Name folder as Test10F Accept create folder Cut paste video files operation completed successfully Test10F: Data move operation completed successfully Pass: Test10F Pass for data move operation successfully Final message: Pass Test10F Pass for front camera video recording, Pause Video Playback scenario and data move operation scenario Test:End
